comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:6.0.2) Gecko/20100101 conkeror/1.0pre
Build ID: git

Steps to reproduce:


Components.classes["@mozilla.org/mime;1"]
    .getService(Components.interfaces.nsIMIMEService)
    .getPrimaryExtension("text/blah", null);



Actual results:

When querying nsIMIMEService.getPrimaryExtension for a mime type that is
not registered, with no default provided, an error is thrown (as
expected), but the particular error that is thrown is misleading.  The
error that is thrown is NS_ERROR_NOT_INITIALIZED, which seems to indicate
that the mime service has not been initialized, which is not the case at
all.



Expected results:

It would be helpful if a more appropriate error code could be thrown, something
that indicates more specifically that the given mime type was NOT FOUND.
